page.title: 05ECOLOGY & FARMING
page.content: Chalk downland,some small copses,good hedges,some hedgerow trees but elms destroyed by Dutch Elm disease,early 1980's.Abundance of wild flowers on roadside verged & valley pastures. Bluebells in copses.Numerous birds in field,wood & garden.Ancient sheep & cattle Droves overgrown in parts,well -walked in others.A few footpaths, clearly signposted,not extensively used.Some rabbits in hedgerow banks, a few hares & foxes,some sightings of deer & badgers.Weather-generally drier than most areas of Dorset.Several very long dry periods during the summers of the past 10 years meant grazing difficulties for animals.Farming- large areas of cereal crops,mostly wheat & barley.Pastures support dairy herds-mostly Friesians,beef cattle & sheep.Stud farm at Warmwell. Smallholdings of goats & poultry.
